projects.name: 2024 Support Albania’s participation with intergovernmental mechanisms promoting gender equality and women’s empowerment and follow-up on respective recommendations, namely the Commission on the Statu

framework.name: Human capital development & social inclusion
framework.description: Integrating quality, inclusive 21st C. education and learning readiness; Effective and inclusive health care and services and social protection within a strategic UN system approach focused on sustaining investment in people, especially those at risk of exclusion - as part of COVID-19 response and r

children.name: Outcome 1 - Human Capital Development
children.description: By 2026 there is increased and more equitable investment in people, removing barriers  and creating opportunities for those at risk of exclusion

children.name: 1.1 Social Protection
children.description: Social protection systems and mechanisms are strengthened to increase the coverage, quality, and monitoring of cash benefits and social care services and affordable housing for vulnerable groups

children.name: 1.2 Education
children.description: Education institutions have improved policy, digital knowledge, infrastructure, tools, and budgets to offer inclusive learning and 21st century skills   to boys and girls and especially vulnerable groups (all education levels and including in emergencies)

children.name: 1.3 Health care
children.description: The health system has increased capacities to achieve SDG 3 and UHC targets, providing quality people-centred services  at an affordable cost, including during emergencies, and improving the social, economic and environmental determinants of health

children.name: 1.4 Shock responsive systems for effective disaster and pandemic preparedness and response
children.description: Health and social protection systems have increased capacities to prepare for and respond to emergencies and pandemics and to promote increased community resilience

children.name: 1.5 Inclusive Community engagement
children.description: Communities and CSOs enjoy greater capacities and working mechanisms to participate in planning, service delivery, and monitoring to enhance the quality of services and improve access for vulnerable groups

framework.name: Sustainable, resilient and green economic growth and resource management
framework.description: Inclusive, resilient economic development and shared prosperity (including effective skills training, decent, formal sector jobs, entrepreneurship, support for green and blue economy transitions and increased production and incomes from agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, greater climate and dis

children.name: Outcome 2 - Economic Growth, Innovation and Climate Change
children.description: By 2026 innovative and integrated policy solutions accelerate sustainable, productive and inclusive economic development, enhancing climate change adaptation and mitigation and transition to a green and blue economy

children.name: 2.5 DRR
children.description: Policies, capacities and mechanisms enhanced for effective disaster risk reduction, preparedness and response at all levels

children.name: 2.6 Sustainable cities
children.description: Capacities of urban municipalities increased to implement sustainable development policies and programmes

children.name: 2.1 Employment and skills development
children.description: Government institutions have increased capacities to strengthen policies and services that address the skills mismatch and increase labour force participation and decent work, especially for young people, vulnerable groups and the long term unemployed

children.name: 2.2 Sustainable and resilient economic growth and green and blue economy transition
children.description: Economic policy measures and programmes are designed, piloted, and tracked to promote sustainable, climate resilient, green and blue economic growth and women’s economic empowerment with focus on ‘building back better’

children.name: 2.3 Innovation
children.description: Policies and programme measures are developed to promote digital economy, entrepreneurship and growth of competitive SMEs/ SMAEs, and increased spending on R&D

children.name: 2.4 Climate and ecosystem resources
children.description: Planning and coordination mechanisms strengthened for climate change adaptation and mitigation and enhanced environmental management, conservation and protection, ensuring integration of gender equality commitments

framework.name: Effective, people-centred governance, rule of law, human rights and gender equality
framework.description: Transparent and accountable institutions, delivering quality, inclusive services, enabling rule of law and increased access to justice, and implementing human rights commitments.

children.name: Outcome 3 - Governance, Rule of Law, and Human Rights
children.description: By 2026, governance is more transparent and accountable, enabling people (women and girls, men and boys, and persons at risk of exclusion), to enjoy quality, inclusive services, enhanced rule of law and access to justice in line with Albania’s human rights commitments

children.name: 3.1 Access to justice
children.description: Law enforcement and justice institutions have improved capacities, structures, tools, and evidence to address gaps in legislation and strengthen justice system performance in line with international and national standards.

children.name: 3.2 Good governance, participation and voice
children.description: Integrated multi-sector mechanisms will be created and strengthened to support dialogue and strengthen policy formulation, based on good governance principles (Cooperation efforts will promote inclusion and build higher levels of trust in society, and enable rights holders, especially from excluded

children.name: 3.3 Data and evidence
children.description: Cooperation Framework partners have increased capacities to generate quality disaggregated data to strengthen policies and programmes (quantitative and qualitative, results-based, gender sensitive, responsive to demographic changes and the situation of vulnerable groups)

children.name: 3.4 Public sector accountability and quality services
children.description: Institutions at national and municipal level have enhanced capacities and ‘open-government’ mechanisms to deliver quality services, promote consultation and participation, carry-out integrity planning, fight corruption and organized crime, and strengthen participation of civil society and citizens,

children.name: 3.5 Accountability and oversight for human rights
children.description: The Parliament, National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs have strengthened capacities and mechanisms to assess the implementation of human rights and gender equality legislation, policies and strategies and to promote and protect the realisation of Albania’s human rights and gender equalit

children.name: 3.6 Migration and asylum
children.description: The Government has increased capacities to i. Strengthen policies and legislation for effective migration and asylum governance, ii. Enhance the management of mixed movements of refugees and migrants including reception and identification of persons with special needs, iii Offer effective protection

children.name: Outcome 4 - Gender Responsive Governance
children.description: By 2026, gender responsive governance strengthens equality and non-discrimination, promotes women’s empowerment and human rights, and reduces violence against women and children

children.name: 4.1 End violence against women and children
4.2 Addressing gender stereotypes and harmful norms and practices
children.description: Influential leaders, communities, families, men and boys, women and girls have improved knowledge and capacities to address harmful norms, stereotypes, and behaviors that drive gender discrimination, VAW, VAC, child marriage  (Including intersection with other grounds of discrimination: age, ethnici

children.name: 4.3 Gender Responsive Planning and Budgeting
children.description: Government institutions at central and local levels have increased capacities to plan, budget, monitor, track expenditures, and leverage resources for GEWE in targeted sectors.

children.name: 4.4 Gender Equality Mechanisms
children.description: National Gender Machinery and public administration at central and local level have increased capacities support and monitor implementation of international and national commitments and EU priorities for gender equality (CEDAW, BPfA, Istanbul Convention, UNSCR1325, Agenda 2030 and SDG5).

children.name: 4.5 Leadership and Participation
children.description: Women and girls and gender equality advocates have increased capacities and opportunities to lead, participate, and influence decision making processes at national and local level.
